result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan D. Reitman

records.addlTxt: Hearing on December 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:27 AM Attorney Alexis Garuz in court for Ryan D. Reitman. Attorney appears by authorization. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense has discovery and an offer, defendant is competing treatment. Defense request another further proceeding date. State does not object. Court sets.
Hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.
Letter dated 10/13/2022, filed by Atty Garuz, re: Address Update

ADDRESS INFO for Ryan D. Reitman
Current: 1245 Prairie Creek Blvd #107, Oconomowoc, WI 53066 United States  (Effective: 10-13-2022)
Prior: 480 Rip Van Winkle Dr, Waukesha, WI 53186 United States

addressed to: Ryan D Reitman for hearing on October 24, 2022
Return to Sender, Temporarily Away, Unable to Forward.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.  Defendant to have no contact with victims A & B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

AMENDMENT MADE ON 09/15/2022:
Court will continue bail conditions, with the exception of compliance re: restraining order issued in Waukesha County Case No. 22CV1256.
Hearing on October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:37 AM Defendant Ryan D. Reitman in court.  Attorney Alexis Garuz in court for Ryan D. Reitman.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M Jay in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Both sides are prepared to proceed with bail motion. 

Defense makes statements in support of request to modify bond condition of no-contact with Victim A to no violent contact with Victim A and her residence, as it relates to the Defendant moving his belongings out of the residence. 
State objects to modification of bond condition re: contact, but does not object to allowing the Defendant 

Court will continue bail conditions, with the exception of compliance re: restraining order issued in Waukesha County Case No. 22CV1256.

Atty Garuz requests to move out hearing set for 10/03/2022. Court will set. 

Defense does not have a pre-trial offer, and has received discovery. 
State will send a pre-trial offer. 
Defense updates the Defendant's address.
Hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
